title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, the context for nested classes is not set correctly. This causes the 'Enclosing Type' field to be blank when it should default to the current type in the editor.
OB: When using the new class wizard with a .java file open in the editor, clicking the new class button and checking 'Enclosing Type', the field is blank.
EB: When using the new class wizard with a .java file open in the editor, clicking the new class button and checking 'Enclosing Type', the field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the wizard.
